Just spent 3 days at the Gonzalez Guesthouse with my 9 yr old and loved it. We booked the trip very short notice (the night before) to tube the Frio River for the first time and explore the surrounding area. The property was easy to find if you follow Marco’s directions once you get off 83. I would simplify them even more to R on Elm, L on Homestead, R on Uvalde Oaks Drive, and the guesthouse is on the L #303. Just look for the big yellow Harley Davidson sign. You can’t miss it. Marco loves his bikes! The owners live right next door to the guesthouse. We were greeted upon arrival by Marco’s lovely wife Leigh and their adorable little dog Cheeky. To call Leigh warm and accommodating would be the understatement of the year. It’s people like Marco and Leigh that give Airbnb a good name. The guesthouse is as cool, funky and eclectic as it looks in the photos. The decor has something for everyone. My kiddo had great fun asking “What’s your favorite decoration/sign?” each day. The beds are very comfortable. We both slept peacefully all three nights. The A/C works great plus there’s a ceiling fan above the beds. The combo kept us cool for our entire stay. The shower works great too. Everything you need is provided but if you could think of anything they’ve missed, they’d get it for you pronto anyway. Marco and Leigh made great recommendations for local dining which I’ll list at the end, and Leigh helped prepare us for tubing the Frio as first-timers. We used Andy’s on the River, who provide a shuttle service to pick you up once you’re done. We tubed both days and it was wonderful - sunscreen is a must and needs to be reapplied often for protection as you’re out there for 3 hours or more. It’s an easy 25 minute drive from the guesthouse to the river. By the time we left we had made friends for life of Marco and Leigh. They are great hosts and their hospitality and easy going south Texas nature is a winning combo. My kiddo got so attached to Leigh and Cheeky that she shed tears for 30 minutes once we hit the road and made me promise we’ll be back. We will 😉
The following restaurants were all suggested by Marco and Leigh and are excellent.
Julio’s Grill for breakfast. Uvalde.
Broadway 830 Artisan Pizza. Uvalde.
Hippie Chicks River Shack for burgers, chicken etc on the river. Concan.
The Frio Float for ice cream, shakes, house made chocolate, & gifts. Concan.
Enjoy!

We used stargazer apps to locate constellations, identify planets, and enjoyed the breeze and peace and quiet, all from the front porch. We spent time in Uvalde (about 5 minutes to town) and at Garner State Park (about 40 minutes away) during our trip. Austin & Sarah are great hosts.
